page.topic: Toggle display of a container or DIV with animation
page.description: Adds toggle animation to a DIV or container. When the action is run the dive or container will be shown or hidden using a specified animation such as 'slide' or 'puff'. Different animations can be specified for the show and hide events. Different animation times can also be set in this actions properties list.

section.description: Used with the Grid and UX components. This action is described in [this video].

item.name: Mode
item.description: Specify if the visibility of the element should be toggled, or explicitly set to shown or hidden.

item.name: Object type
item.description: Specify if the object you want to toggle the visibility or is a Container control, or arbitrary DIV.

item.name: DIV ID
item.description: Specify the ID of the DIV.

item.name: Show animation style
item.description: Select the animation method to use when the window is shown. Fade and Slide use methods in jQuery core. Other options require jQueryUI.

item.name: Show animation speed
item.description: Specify the animation speed. You can select a pre-defined option (slow = 600 milliseconds, fast = 200 milliseconds), or you can enter an explicit value in milliseconds.

item.name: onShowComplete Javascript
item.description: (Optional) Specify the Javascript to execute when the animation that shows the element has completed.

item.name: Hide animation style
item.description: Select the animation method to use when the window is closed. Fade and Slide use methods in jQuery core. Other options require jQueryUI.

item.name: Hide animation speed
item.description: Specify the animation speed. You can select a pre-defined option (slow = 600 milliseconds, fast = 200 milliseconds), or you can enter an explicit value in milliseconds.

item.name: onHideComplete Javascript
item.description: (Optional) Specify the Javascript to execute when the animation that hides the element has completed.

step.description: In the UX Builder on the UX Controls page open the 'Other Controls' menu. Click on the [Static Text] option to add a Static Text control to the component.
In the properties list on the right of the controls page click the [...] button next to the 'Static text' property in the 'Button Properties' section.
Define the following <div> and click OK. Make sure the div has an id.
step.example: This is the Static Text that will be animated when the toggle display action fires.

step.description: In the 'Other Controls' menu click on the [Button] option to add a button control to the component.
In the properties list change the 'Button text' property to read 'Toggle'.
Scroll down to the 'Javascript - (Touch, Mouse, Pointer Events)' section and click the [...] button next to the 'click' property.
In the 'Edit Click Event' dialog check the 'Action Javascript' radio button and then click the 'Add New Action' button.
Type 'toggle' into the Filter list and select the 'Toggle display of a container or DIV with animation' action from the actions list. Click OK.
In the Toggle Display properties list set the 'Mode' property to 'Toggle Visibility'.
Set the 'Object type' property to be 'DIV'
Next to the 'DIV ID' property type 'div1'. This is the id of the div that was defined in the Static Text control.
For the 'Show animation style' property select 'Slide'
For the 'Hide animation style' property select 'Fade'. Click OK and Save to exit.
Run the component in Live Preview. Click the Toggle button. The Static Text control should disappear using the 'Fade' animation
Click the Toggle button again and the Static Text should reappear on the screen using the 'Slide' animation.
